pullRequest.body:
An AB4 category is a category in which taking coproducts is exact, an AB5 category is one where taking filtered colimits is exact. This shows that any Abelian catgory which is AB5 is also AB4.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11466604703/job/31907629381)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11466604703/job/31907629716)
Could you add a more general `PreservesLimitsOfSize` instance, with arbitrary universe parameters and suitable `HasLimitsOfSize` assumption?
We don't need the more specific one then, do we? Mirrored the way `whiskeringRightPreservesLimits` does it.
A `HasFiniteCoproducts` assumption would be more consistent with the docstring, and it seems we have `hasCoproducts_of_finite_and_filtered`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Abelian): AB5 implies AB4
